title: DataFest 2025
text:
Participants
Registration to participate in DataFest 2025 for undergraduate students at Northwestern is not yet open. Please check back soon!

title: DataFest 2025
text:
Mentors
Registration to participate as mentors to undergraduate teams in DataFest 2025 at Northwestern is not yet open. Please check back soon!

title: DataFest 2025
text:
Questions
If you have any questions about your registration, or about the DataFest, please contact Krish at krish [at] northwestern.edu

title: DataFest 2025
text: Welcome to the official website of the first-ever DataFest at Northwestern! The event is primarily about a data science competition, where student teams compete for glory and prizes! The event also includes data scientists from both industry and academia to interact with and advise curious students. Also, there will be lots of food!

title: DataFest 2025
text: Welcome to the official website of the first-ever DataFest at Northwestern! The event is primarily about a data science competition, where student teams compete for glory and prizes! The event also includes data scientists from both industry and academia to interact with and advise curious students. Also, there will be lots of food!

title: DataFest 2025
text:
Event details
Date: Friday, April 4 at 5 pm - Sunday, April 6 at 7 pm
Venue: Guild lounge (in Scott Hall) on April 4 & 6, Wildcat room 1-163 (in Norris) on April 5
Participants: All UG students are invited to participate, while graduate students are invited to mentor student teams.
You will be provided with a dataset and an open-ended goal on Friday evening. By Sunday afternoon, you will have to develop and present solutions to a panel of judges comprised of faculty and professionals involved in the field of Data Science. There will be prizes in many categories, such as best visualization, best use of external data, and best findings. A finalized list of categories will be announced at the beginning of the competition.
The event also includes a keynote speech from a leading industry expert, and a panel discussion on Careers in data science comprising of both faculty and industry professionals.

title: DataFest 2025
text:
What is DataFest?
ASA DataFest at Northwestern is a data analysis competition organized by the Department of Statistics and Data Science at Northwestern University in collaboration with ASA (American Statistical Association).
Teams of 3 - 5 students analyse a potentially large & complex dataset, over a weekend. The problem statement is typically broad and open-ended, providing a lot of room for innovation. Your job is to find and communicate insights from the data that help answer the problem statement. You will be encoraged to ask questions and receive advice from mentors, while working on the problem.
ASA DataFest is also a great opportunity to gain experience that employers are looking for. Having worked on a data analysis problem at this scale will certainly help make you a good candidate for any position that involves analysis and critical thinking, and it will provide a concrete example to demonstrate your experience during interviews.
You will also get the opportunity to interact with data scientists from industry and academia, to get some insights about a data science career.
Food & drinks will be provided throughout the event to keep you going! We hope that everyone has an enjoyable and enlightening experience!

title: DataFest 2025
text:
Previous ASA DataFests
Although this is the first-ever DataFest at Northwestern, several top universities all over the world have been collaborating with ASA to host DataFests since 2011. Here is the link to the problem statements of the previous DataFests.

title: FAQs
text: Registration will open Spring 2025.

title: FAQs
text: Registration will open Spring 2025.

title: FAQs
section: What do I bring to DataFest?
text:
What do I bring to DataFest?
Please bring a laptop, charger and refillable water bottle.

title: FAQs
text:
Is there a registration fee?
No, there is no registration fee. However note that the event takes significant resources to run. So, if you sign up, we expect that you will show up! If your plans change, let us know as soon as possible so we can make your spot available to someone else.

title: FAQs
text:
Who is eligible to compete?
All undergraduate students are eligible.

title: FAQs
text:
What about PhD students?
We would like to have Ph.D. students be involved as mentors during the event.

title: FAQs
section: Can I participate as a mentor if I’m an MS student?
text:
Can I participate as a mentor if I’m an MS student?
Sure!

title: FAQs
text:
How large are the teams?
Teams can be made up of 3 - 5 students.

title: FAQs
section: Do I have to compete in a team?
text:
Do I have to compete in a team?
Yes, but if you don’t have a team in mind, select the “Looking for team” registration under the sign ups page and we’ll match you with others looking for teammates.

title: FAQs
section: What do I need to compete?
text:
What do I need to compete?
All you need is a laptop with tools for data analysis (there is no limitation on which software you use) and enthusiasm for data.

title: FAQs
section: What are the rules of the competition?
text:
What are the rules of the competition?

All projects must be submitted by Sunday, April 6 There is only one submission per team.
Any additional data used in the project must be publicly available or openly licensed.
All interactive dashboards must be deployed online.
All slide decks and write ups must be submitted as a PDF document.
It’s a competition, but a friendly one, so collaboration between teams is not only allowed but highly encouraged.

title: FAQs
section: How do I submit my analysis?
text:
How do I submit my analysis?

Once the registration window closes, participants will receive an email with a link to the project submission form.

title: FAQs
section: Where can I get help during the competition?
text:
Where can I get help during the competition?
Mentors will be available in-person on Saturday (at times TBA) to answer questions.

title: FAQs
text:
What can I win?
Prizes are being decided. Everyone gets a t-shirt!

title: FAQs
section: Where else is ASA DataFest happening?
text:
Where else is ASA DataFest happening?
ASA DataFest is growing fast! See the list of all participating institutions.
